trans-unit.source: Renders a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Geometry3D"></xref> with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Material"></xref>.

If you need to create a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D> that uses multiple materials, you must use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3DGroup> class to combine multiple GeometryModel3D objects.
The front and back sides of the GeometryModel3D are determined by the winding order of the triangles in the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D>.
The front side winds counter clockwise.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeometryModel3D.Material%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeometryModel3D.BackMaterial%2A> properties may be <xref:System.Drawing.Brushes.Transparent%2A> or `null`.
When the material is transparent, you cannot see that side of the triangle, but hit testing works as usual.
When the material is `null`, you cannot see it, and hit testing does not work.
Creates a new instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeometryModel3D"></xref>.
Creates a new instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeometryModel3D"></xref> with the specified Geometry3D and Material.
Geometry of the new mesh primitive.
Material of the new mesh primitive.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Material"></xref> used to render the back of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeometryModel3D"></xref>.
The back side of a mesh is determined by the triangle winding order.
Ordinarily, back faces are not rendered unless the object is transformed or animated.
Back faces are never rendered when BackMaterial is `null`.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Material"></xref> applied to the back of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D"></xref>.
The default value is **null**.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeometryModel3D.BackMaterial*> dependency property.
To be added.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeometryModel3D"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true." name="true." href=""></xref>
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeometryModel3D"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Geometry3D"></xref> that describes the shape of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeometryModel3D"></xref>.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Geometry3D"></xref> that comprises the model.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeometryModel3D.Geometry*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Material"></xref> used to render the front of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeometryModel3D"></xref>.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Material"></xref> applied to the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeometryModel3D"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeometryModel3D.Material*> dependency property.
To be added.
